newsitem.title: USA: AFTER THE BELL - Intuit down on earnings.
newsitem.headline: AFTER THE BELL - Intuit down on earnings.

text.p: Intuit Inc was trading lower at 26-3/4 in the after-hours session against a Nasdaq close of 27-1/8, after the software maker reported quarterly earnings, dealers said Thursday.
"It's the only one that's really trading," said one trader, referring to an otherwise quiet session.

Intuit reported a third-quarter profit of $0.01 a share after charges compared with a loss of $0.01 a year ago. It reported an operating share profit of $0.16 for the quarter, in line with First Call consensus estimates.
Intuit also announced plans to sell its Parson Technologies unit to Broderbund Software Inc.

Echlin Inc was off 5/8 at 33 on news that it foresaw third-quarter earnings down 20 percent to 25 percent. The auto parts maker said it also saw full-year earnings down 10 percent to 15 percent against 1996.
The New York Stock Exchange said session one had a volume of 2,300 shares, compared with 6,600 on Wednesday. Session two had 2.1 million against a much lower 148,300 for the previous day.
